p: We next analyzed the effect of LG in cells infected by different vesicular porcine viruses: FMDV, VSV, and SVDV. VPA was not included in this study since, as we previously reported, VSV is susceptible to this drug while FMDV and SVDV infections are not affected ( Vazquez-Calvo et al., 2011). As shown in Figure 2, a consistent decrease of at least 1 log.u. in the production of both FMDV isolates from serotypes C (C-S8) and O (0-UKG 11/2001, named O-UK) in BHK21 or IBRS-2 cells at different M.O.I.s was observed in the presence of 10 μM LG (IC 50: 0.2–2.5 μM at M.O.Is of 0.01–1 for C-S8; IC 50: 0.7 μM at M.O.I of 1 for O-UK). In the case of cells infected with VSV or SVDV, the presence of LG reduced the virus productivity by 2 or 1 log.u., respectively (IC 50: 0.9 μM for VSV; IC 50: 1.7 μM for SVDV).
